name: Cap
description: The Cap SOP is used to close open areas with flat or rounded coverings. Meshes are capped by extending the mesh in either the U or V direction (e.g. a NURBS tube). Faces are capped by appending a separate face or hull cap.

The Cap  is used to close open areas with flat or rounded coverings. Meshes are capped by extending the mesh in either the U or V direction (e.g. a NURBS tube). Faces are capped by appending a separate face or hull cap.
capSOP_Class

Contents
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 





  group - Specify the  Group to apply the caps to. See Group SOP to create primitive groups.





  pshapeu - When capping a NURBS surface, use this option to preserve the original surface by clamping it at the point of capping.


		
  firstu -  - Select an option from the menu:

 none - Leave this side of the primitive unaffected. facet - Cap by creating a face of a similar type which uses unique points. share - Cap by creating a face of a similar type which shares points with the original primitive. round - Cap by creating / extending a mesh containing a number of concentric circular regions. This creates a bullet or domed shaped cap. tangent -
		
  divsu1 - Number of cross sections in the rounded cap.


		
  scaleu1 - Affects the height of the rounded cap (both positive and negative).


		
  lastu -  - Similar to First Cap U / V, but builds a cap on the other end of the primitive in the opposite direction.

 none - facet - share - round - tangent -
		
  divsu2 - Number of cross sections in the rounded cap.


		
  scaleu2 - Affects the height of the rounded cap (both positive and negative).





  pshapev - When capping a NURBS surface, use this option to preserve the original surface by clamping it at the point of capping.


		
  firstv -  - Select an option from the menu:

 none - Leave this side of the primitive unaffected. facet - Cap by creating a face of a similar type which uses unique points. share - Cap by creating a face of a similar type which shares points with the original primitive. round - Cap by creating / extending a mesh containing a number of concentric circular regions. This creates a bullet or domed shaped cap. tangent -
		
  divsv1 - Number of cross sections in the rounded cap.


		
  scalev1 - Affects the height of the rounded cap (both positive and negative).


		
  lastv -  - Similar to First Cap U / V, but builds a cap on the other end of the primitive in the opposite direction.

 none - facet - share - round - tangent -
		
  divsv2 - Number of cross sections in the rounded cap.


		
  scalev2 - Affects the height of the rounded cap (both positive and negative).

A Operator Family that reads, creates and modifies 3D points, polygons, lines, particles, surfaces, spheres and meatballs. Particles and point clouds are now done primarily on the GPU using TOPs.



A surface type in SOPs that includes polygon, curve (NURBS and Bezier), patch (NURBS and Bezier) and other basic shapes like sphere, tube and metaball. Points and Primitives are part of the Geometry Detail, which is a part of a SOP.



An Operator Family which operate on Channels (a sequence of numbers (Samples)) which are used for animation, audio, mathematics, simulation, logic, UI construction, and data streamed from/to devices and protocols.



The Graphics Processing Unit. This is the high-speed, many-core processor of the graphics card/chip that takes geometry, images and data from the CPU and creates images and processed data.
